result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan Joseph Bartes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryan Joseph Bartes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryan Joseph Bartes was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bryan Joseph Bartes was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System. Consecutive.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
To be supervised by the Mental Health Unit.

miscConds.notes: Complete a mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication.
Successfully complete Batterer's Intervention Program. Complete a parenting class. Cooperate fully with probation agent.
AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol. Random screens. No violent contact with the victim.

Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Pay all court costs, assessments and fees, including all mandatory fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Cash bail on deposit to apply.
Possess no firearms.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.

timeConds.notes: STAYED until next court date, 10-24-14 review hearing.

supervisions.notes:
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Possess no firearms. Court advised that due to this domestic abuse conviction, defendant may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 07/09/14. AR
CT 2
CT 1

Defendant Bryan Joseph Bartes in court with attorney Eric D Lowenberg.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 3 1/2 YEARS CONSECUTIVE, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 60 DAYS  in the House of Correction, STAYED, until next court date.
-Be supervised by the Mental Health Unit, complete a mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication.
-Successfully complete Batterer's Intervention Program.
-Complete a parenting class.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random screens.
-No violent contact with the victim.
-Possess no firearms.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees, including all mandatory fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 85 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 85 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised that due to this domestic abuse conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  T

Defendant Bryan Joseph Bartes in court with attorney Robert J Penegor. via telephone.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Case before the court to address Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Positive Drug Tests. Court admonished defendant for failure to comply with conditions of bail. Defense counsel requested time to meet with client regarding violation report. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending Sentencing. Court set matter for bail bond hearing in branch 40 prior to Sentencing date of 7/3/2014.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

AS TO COUNT 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered charge dismissed.
*
AS TO COUNT 1 AND TO COUNT 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The 6/23/14 jury trial is vacated.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Bryan Joseph Bartes in court with attorney Robert J Penegor.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Repeater, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Gina H

Defendant Bryan Joseph Bartes in court with attorney Dawn Rablin.  Defendant Bryan Joseph Bartes in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. State moves to amend the statute in Count 1 to 939.50(3)(i) Possession of Tetrahydrocannabinols (THC), Second or Subsequent a Class I Felony.  State to file an amended complaint on the next date.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
